==Events==
* [[763]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Bakhamra]] between Alids and Abbasids near Kufa ends in a decisive Abbasid victory.
*[[1525]] &ndash; The [[Switzerland|Swiss]] [[Anabaptist]] Movement is founded when [[Conrad Grebel]], [[Felix Manz]], [[George Blaurock]], and about a dozen others baptize each other in the home of Manz's mother in [[Zürich]], breaking a thousand-year tradition of church-state union.
*[[1535]] &ndash; Following the [[Affair of the Placards]], French Protestants are burned at the stake in front of the Cathedral of [[Notre-Dame de Paris]]
*[[1720]] &ndash; [[Sweden]] and [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussia]] sign the [[Treaty of Stockholm (Great Northern War)|Treaty of Stockholm]].
*[[1749]] &ndash; The [[Teatro Filarmonico (Verona)|Teatro Filarmonico]] in Verona is destroyed by fire. It is rebuilt in 1754.
*[[1789]] &ndash; The first American novel, [[The Power of Sympathy|''The Power of Sympathy or the Triumph of Nature Founded in Truth'']], is printed in [[Boston, Massachusetts]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; After being found guilty of treason by the [[French Convention]], [[Louis XVI of France]] is executed by [[guillotine]].
*[[1840]] &ndash; [[Jules Dumont d'Urville]] discovers [[Adélie Land]], [[Antarctica]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Jefferson Davis]] resigns from the [[United States Senate]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; The [[Tauranga Campaign]] begins during the [[Maori Wars]].
*[[1887]] &ndash; {{Convert|465|mm|in}} of rain falls in [[Brisbane]], a record for any [[Australia]]n capital city.
*[[1893]] &ndash; The [[Tati Concessions Land]], formerly part of [[Matabeleland]], is formally annexed to the [[Bechuanaland Protectorate]], now [[Botswana]].
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Opel]] manufactures its first automobile.
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[New York City]] passes the [[Sullivan Ordinance]], making it illegal for women to smoke in public, only to have the measure vetoed by the mayor.
*[[1911]] &ndash; The first [[Monte Carlo Rally]] takes place.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Kiwanis International]] is founded in [[Detroit, Michigan]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; Meeting of the First [[Dáil Éireann]] in the [[Mansion House, Dublin|Mansion House]] [[Dublin]]. [[Sinn Féin]] adopts [[Ireland]]'s first constitution. The first engagement of [[Irish War of Independence]], Sologhead Beg, [[County Tipperary]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Albania]] declares itself a republic.
*[[1931]] &ndash; Sir [[Isaac Isaacs]] is sworn in as the first [[Australia]]n-born [[Governor-General of Australia]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; Sparked by the murder of a German officer in [[Bucharest]], [[Romania]], the day before, members of the [[Iron Guard]] engaged in a [[Legionnaires' rebellion and Bucharest pogrom|rebellion and pogrom]] killing 125 Jews.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Flag of Quebec]] is adopted and flown for the first time over the [[National Assembly of Quebec]]. The day is marked annually as Quebec [[Flag Day]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; American lawyer and government official [[Alger Hiss]] is convicted of [[perjury]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; The first [[nuclear marine propulsion|nuclear-powered]] [[submarine]], the {{USS|Nautilus|SSN-571|6}}, is [[Ship naming and launching|launched]] in [[Groton, Connecticut]] by [[Mamie Eisenhower]], the [[First Lady of the United States]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The last [[Fokker C.X]] in military service, the [[Finnish Air Force]] FK-111 target tower, crashes, killing the pilot and winch-operator.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Little Joe 1B]], a [[Project Mercury|Mercury]] spacecraft, lifts off from [[Wallops Island]], [[Virginia]] with [[Monkeys in space|Miss Sam]], a female [[Rhesus Macaque|rhesus monkey]] on board.
*  1960   &ndash; [[Avianca Flight 671]] crashes and burns upon landing at [[Montego Bay]], [[Jamaica]], killing 37. It is the worst air disaster in Jamaica's history and the first for [[Avianca]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; 435 workers are buried alive when a mine in [[Coalbrook, Free State]] collapses.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[Battle of Khe Sanh]] &ndash; One of the most publicized and controversial battles of the war begins.
*  1968   &ndash; A [[B-52]] bomber [[1968 Thule Air Base B-52 crash|crashes]] near [[Thule Air Base]], contaminating the area after its nuclear payload ruptures. One of the four bombs remains unaccounted for after the cleanup operation is complete.
*[[1971]] &ndash; The current [[Emley Moor transmitting station]], the tallest free-standing structure in the [[United Kingdom]], begins transmitting [[UHF]] broadcasts.
*[[1976]] &ndash; Commercial service of ''[[Concorde]]'' begins with the [[Concorde#Scheduled flights|London-Bahrain and Paris-Rio]] routes.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[President of the United States]] [[Jimmy Carter]] pardons nearly all [[United States|American]] [[Vietnam War]] draft evaders, some of whom had emigrated to [[Canada]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; Production of the iconic [[DeLorean DMC-12]] sports car begins in [[Dunmurry]], [[Northern Ireland]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; The [[U.S. House of Representatives]] votes 395–28 to reprimand [[Newt Gingrich]] for ethics violations, making him the first Speaker of the House to be so disciplined.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[War on Drugs]]: In one of the largest drug busts in American history, the [[United States Coast Guard]] intercepts a ship with over {{convert|4300|kg|lb}} of [[cocaine]] on board.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Ecuador]]: After the Ecuadorian Congress is seized by indigenous organizations, Col. [[Lucio Gutierrez]], Carlos Solorzano and Antonio Vargas depose President [[Jamil Mahuad]].  Gutierrez is later replaced by Gen. Carlos Mendoza, who resigns and allows Vice-President [[Gustavo Noboa]] to succeed Mahuad.
*[[2003]] &ndash; A 7.6 magnitude [[2003 Colima earthquake|earthquake]] strikes the Mexican state of [[Colima]], killing 29 and leaving approximately 10,000 people homeless.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[NASA]]'s [[MER-A]] (the Mars Rover ''Spirit'') ceases communication with mission control. The problem lies in the management of its [[flash memory]] and is fixed remotely from Earth on February 6.
*[[2005]] &ndash; In [[Belmopan]], [[Belize]], the [[Unrest in Belize in 2005|unrest over the government's new taxes]] erupts into [[riot]]s.
